question: In which of the following states of India, Yakshagana, a dance drama is popular
explanation: Yakshagana is a traditional Indian theatre form, developed in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi, Uttara Kannada, Shimoga and western parts of Chikmagalur districts, in the state of Karnataka. It is also found in Kasaragod district in Kerala that combines dance, music, dialogue, costume, make-up, and stage techniques with a unique style.
